    • averageCalories

      public static int averageCalories​(java.util.ArrayList<Food> foods)
      Determines the average calories in a list of foods. (May assume foods is not empty.)
      Parameters:
      foods - a list of Food
      Returns:
      average calories in all Food objects

    • averageCaloriesByOrigin

      public static double averageCaloriesByOrigin​(java.util.ArrayList<Food> foods, int origin)
      Determines the average calories in a list of foods for a particular origin.
      Parameters:
      foods - a list of Food
      origin - the origin of the Food
      Returns:
      average calories for all Foods of the specified origin

    • getByOrigin

      Creates a list of foods by origin.
      Parameters:
      foods - a list of Food
      origin - a food origin
      Returns:
      a list of Food from origin

    • getFood

      public static Food getFood​(java.util.Scanner keyboard)
      Creates a Food object by requesting data from a user in the format: 
       Name:
 Origin:
 Vegetarian (Y/N): 
 Calories:
      Parameters:
      keyboard - Scanner keyboard input
      Returns:
      a Food object

    • readFood

      public static Food readFood​(java.lang.String line)
      Creates and returns a food object from a line of string data.
      Parameters:
      line - a vertical bar-delimited line of food data in the format name|origin|vegetarian|calories
      Returns:
      the data from line as a Food object

    • readFoods

      public static java.util.ArrayList<Food> readFoods​(java.io.File file) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      Reads a file of food strings into a list of Food objects.
      Parameters:
      file - a file of Food
      Returns:
      a list of Food
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - file not found

    • foodSearch

      public static java.util.ArrayList<Food> foodSearch​(java.util.ArrayList<Food> foods, int origin, int maxCalories, boolean vegetarian)
      Searches for foods that fit certain conditions.
      Parameters:
      foods - a list of Food
      origin - the origin of the food; if -1, accept any origin
      maxCalories - the maximum calories for the food; if 0, accept any
      vegetarian - whether the food is vegetarian or not; if false accept any
      Returns:
      a list of foods that fit the conditions specified

    • writeFoods

      public static void writeFoods​(java.util.ArrayList<Food> foods, java.io.PrintStream ps) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException

      Parameters:
      foods - a list of Food
      ps - the PrintStream to write to
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException
